quizzes.question: Every C++ program starts with the function:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Functions[/h1]

A [b]function [/b]is a group of statements that perform a particular task.
You may define your own functions in C++.

Using functions can have many advantages, including the following:
- You can reuse the code within a function.
- You can easily test individual functions.
- If it's necessary to make any code modifications, you can make modifications within a single function, without altering the program structure.
- You can use the same function for different inputs.
[note] Every valid C++ program has at least one function - the [b]main()[/b] function.[/note]

quizzes.question: What should we use if a function does not return any value?

answers.text: Return type, function name, parameters, and a body

quizzes.question: A C++ function consists of:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Defining a Function[/h1]

Define a C++ function using the following syntax:[code format="cpp"]return_type function_name( parameter list )
{
   body of the function
}[/code]
[b]return-type[/b]: Data type of the value returned by the function.
[b]function name[/b]: Name of the function.
[b]parameters[/b]: When a function is invoked, you pass a value to the parameter. This value is referred to as actual parameter or argument. The parameter list refers to the type, order, and number of the parameters of a function. 
[b]body of the function[/b]: A collection of statements defining what the function does. 
[note]Parameters are [b]optional[/b]; that is, you can have a function with no parameters.[/note]
